newsitem.title: UK: Elf UK completes Milford Haven refinery upgrade.
newsitem.headline: Elf UK completes Milford Haven refinery upgrade.

text.p: Elf UK, a subsidiary of French oil company Elf Aquitaine, and Murco Petroleum, a unit of Murphy Oil Corp, have completed a 70 million stg upgrade of their 100,000 barrels per day (bpd) Milford Haven refinery on the south Wales coast, Elf said on Thursday.
They have built a new hydro-desulphurisation plant, used to remove sulphur from oil products, in anticipation of Europe's "green" diesel law coming into effect on October 1, the statement said.
The law requires all European diesel fuel to contain no more than 0.05 percent sulphur, from a previous limit of 0.2 percent.
Construction of the unit began in February 1995, employing 500 workers, and it was brought on stream without interrupting the flow of the refinery.
The sulphur extracted is recovered and sold, thereby reducing emissions of sulphur dioxide into the atmosphere.
